meanings.sent1: The seigneuries of the ancient castle were vast and majestic.
meanings.sent2: The king granted him several seigneuries as a reward for his loyalty.
meanings.sent3: The seigneuries of the nobleman were so large, he needed a map to navigate them.
meanings.sent4: Her influence in the community was like that of a seigneuries, commanding respect and admiration.
meanings.sent5: The seigneuries of the wealthy landowner were the envy of all his neighbors.

meanings.definition: Seigneuries: the estate or lands of a seigneur
meanings.sent1: The lush seigneuries of the countryside were filled with crops and livestock.
meanings.sent2: The seigneuries of the baron stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: The seigneuries of the farmer flourished under the care of his skilled workers.
meanings.sent4: Her love for the seigneuries of her ancestors was evident in the way she preserved them.
meanings.sent5: The seigneuries of the old man held memories of a lifetime of hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: Seigneuries: the rank or authority of a seigneur
meanings.sent1: His seigneuries in the court allowed him to make important decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The seigneuries of the duke were respected by all who knew him.
meanings.sent3: The seigneuries of the mayor were put to the test during the town's crisis.
meanings.sent4: Her seigneuries in the company made her a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent5: The seigneuries of the teacher were evident in the way the students looked up to her.
